document.docAuthor: Volynkin, Anton V., Černý, Karel & Huang, Si-Yao
document.docTitle: Barsine speideli Volynkin & Černý & Huang 2019, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: A review of the Barsine hypoprepioides (Walker, 1862) species-group, with descriptions of fifteen new species and a new subspecies (Lepidoptera, Erebidae, Arctiinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the Barsine hypoprepioides (Walker, 1862) species-group, with descriptions of fifteen new species and a new subspecies (Lepidoptera, Erebidae, Arctiinae)

, sp. n.

Diagnosis . Forewing length is 10.5–13.5 mm in males ( 12.5 mm in the holotype ) and 12–15.5 mm in females. This species is widespread and rather polymorphic: different populations differ significantly in size, while the genitalia structure is very uniform in all parts of the species’ range.
Barsine speideli
sp. n.
is most similar externally to
B. maculifasciata
, but differs by its smaller size, more sharp pattern and slightly less elongated forewing apex. In the male genitalia, the genital capsule of
B. speideli
sp. n.
is most similar to that of
B. nigralba
and
B. fasciata
, but differs by its slightly smaller distal costal process and slightly longer distal saccular process. The vesica structure of
B. speideli
sp. n.
is very different from that of
B. nigralba
and
B. fasciata
and is most similar to that of
B. maculifasciata
and
B. parameia
, but differs by its shorter and broader cluster of cornuti, which are narrower and more elongated in
B. speideli
sp. n.
than those of
B. maculifasciata
and
B. parameia
. In the female genitalia,
B. speideli
sp. n.
is similar to
B. nigralba
and
B. fasciata
, but differs from
B. nigralba
by its narrower antrum without anterior protrusion, much smaller sclerotized posterior area of corpus bursae, smaller signum, evenly scobinated corpus bursae (while that has a narrow transverse band of scobination in
B. nigralba
), and narrower and slightly longer appendix bursae; in comparison to those of
B. fasciata
, the female genitalia of
B. speideli
sp. n.
differ by their narrower antrum without anterior protrusion, much smaller sclerotized posterior area of corpus bursae, much smaller rounded signum (while that is much larger and arrowhead-shaped in
B. fasciata
), evenly scobinated corpus bursae (while that is membranous and has a narrow transverse band of scobination in
B. fasciata
), and shorter and much narrower appendix bursae.
Etymology . The species’ name is dedicated to Dr. Wolfgang Speidel (Olching, Germany ), an authors’ friend and a famous expert in Noctuoidea and Pyraloidea taxonomy.
